job_title: Anonymous Employee in Glen Carbon, IL
pros:
*Meridian Village*

Great benefits, wonderful facility, knowledgeable and dedicated medical staff (from a clinical standpoint and an administrative angle). The administrative staff really got to know the residents individually, so any issues were resolved with knowledge of the resident in mind, rather than just blindly taking action. 

Money/Profit is an issue, of course, but not so much that it impedes care. This place doesn't cut corners, and the abuse reporting/investigating procedures are top-notch. Training is great for most positions. 

I've worked at companies where everyone is a nervous wreck when corporate comes around, because the upper management is out of touch, rash, and blindly making decisions that negatively affect the employees as well as the care provided. This wasn't the experience I had at LSS. Their home office staff is typically very helpful and well-informed. 

I wouldn't want to work at any LTC facility where I wouldn't be comfortable bringing my own loved ones, and this place was truly the best around.
cons:
There was a little drama between departments and certain employees, but no more than you would expect in this field, and it was dealt with accordingly before it affected any resident care. Pay is not the greatest, but the atmosphere is worth it. 

There's diversity among the staff, but I wasn't a huge fan of how little diversity there was among residents. However, I think that may have been specific to the location I worked at.

job_title: Physical Therapist in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: In control of amount of therapy provided
cons: Both in office and homecare

review_title: Great mission but lack of leadership
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros: We live out our mission daily (Older Adults Living Life to the Fullest) through our resident centered care model.  We do a good job of hiring people who truly care about our residents.
cons:
Benefits are mediocre for a healthcare company.  Insurance is expensive if you have any health condition at all (blood tests determine how much you pay).  Time off looks nice at a glance, however is all encompassing of major holidays, sick time, etc so it is sub-standard at best.

The home office has a lot of policies and procedures that hinder management's ability to effectively lead their community.  There is a lot of tension about a "Guardrails" policy that was put in place by past leadership that indicated that communities could manage as they see fit.  They are now trying to standardize across all communities with this policy still being in place.  It results in resentment, frustration, and talking behind everyone's backs.  No one trusts each other.

Lack of communication around big changes coming down the pipeline.

job_title: Dining Services in Columbia, MO
pros: The people are terrific, truly caring about the residents, and hard-working, for the most part. The facilities are beautiful and well-cared for.
cons: The marketing ploy of leaving kitchens and dining areas open to residents at all hours is unsanitary and dangerous.  Nursing staff tends to use dining staff as "babysitters" so that they can get off their feet and onto their phones for a while.

job_title: Dining Services Associate in Webster Groves, St. Louis, MO
pros: Most of the residents are pleasant, staff is friendly, pay is decent for a starting job
cons: Unusually high turnover rate, poor communication, manager was constantly overwhelmed and would take it out on us

review_title: Very busy environment, with amazing, hard-working, caring and helpful to staff.

review_title: Talk about values and culture change, but actions aren't consistent with words.
job_title: Nursing in Webster Groves, St. Louis, MO
pros: Some nice people to work with as well as residents & their families.

Management was lacking in experience, unable to give consistent direction, decisions were made without fully looking into situations or thinking about long-term consequences, a lot of talk without follow-through.  Communication & teamwork between departments is lacking.  Some long-term staff very resistant to change or new ideas.  Seem to be interested in only doing the minimum and putting their time in until they retire or find another job.

review_title: Gotta take the bad with the good
job_title: Management in Jefferson City, MO
pros: Christian based company with the mission of providing the best care possible for elders.
cons: The company changed significantly in the 6 years I worked for them.  Originally, the residents came above all else and the employees came in a close second.  Through the years, the focus moved more toward profit than to keeping the residents and employees happy.  Happy employees = happy residents.

review_title: Great opportunity for career development and growth!

pros: Fast paced organization with opportunities to grow personally and professionally! Lutheran Senior Services Mission is to help "Older Adults Live Life to the Fullest" and this mission can be seen in all of the programs and initiatives that the organization is undertaking in order to touch the lives of those we serve.
cons: No paid maternity leave; but other programs exist to help offset the lack of this benefit. Could be improved.

job_title: Office Assistant in Saint Louis, MO

cons: There are none. The only reason I left was because I found something closer to home.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Webster Groves, St. Louis, MO
pros: There is a large number of dedicated staff, however, there is an equal amount of those who don't care in the least.
cons: It doesn't appear the company cares to much about their employees... They like to say they do, but they sure have a crap way of showing it.

job_title: Senior Billing Specialist in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The HR person that hired me was very courteous and professional.  Senior Management does seem to sincerely care about the residents and their reputation as a company and strives diligently to find ways of bettering their services in the community.
cons:
If you are applying for a billing position at the LSS Corporate Office please BEWARE!!!!!!  A certain member of management will be nice just long enough to get you in the door, as it was explained to me by a current employee.  There is virtually no training program in place for the position that I had, as was explained to me after I was hired. This certain member of management was EXTREMELY difficult to work with and seems much more interested in doing her own work and in not being bothered than in anything else, including training you, your reputation, the reputation of  the company and how she is impacting it, and her employees.  She is a HORRIBLE boss and trainer and she assumes that because she knows, you should know.  You might hear, how I did, how she has sent other employees home crying many times because she is simply impossible to work with.  I was told, as an explanation for her behavior, "You think she's bad now? You should have seen her years ago, she's improved, trust me!"  You will be expected to know how to operate their very confusing software with no opportunity to ask questions and will discover that no one else has the time to train you and you  will keep being reminded of how overly stressed and overworked everyone is. Your every move WILL BE monitored from a person on the team that this certain member of management has appropriated to watch you and report back to her, this was also put in writing.  When you try to offer ANY explanation as to the outright untruths in what this certain member of management  was told and has accused you of in writing, you could be told by her boss, as I was, that this employee "could not lie if her life depended on it".  This was the same employee that was taking 45 minute lunches from combining her lunch and afternoon break AND was taking a 15 minute afternoon break and that was on her computer on the internet surfing frequently when I would walk up to her desk to ask her a work-related question.
You will be in a very small cube with only two walls to hold up your desktop and you will be sitting out in the open with several other employees that will talk and tell you many things about how bad it is to work there, but are too afraid to go to management, primarily because of things like what happened to me when I went to the next level up in management.  I was told that this manager, in her opinion, is virtually a perfect employee, and that they have worked together for years and you will not be allowed to SAY ONE SINGLE SENTENCE.  You will notice how attitudes and demeanors magically change and become professional and supportive of you whenever managers from another area are within ear shot.  This certain member of  management went on vacation right after I started working there and I was told in the morning, the day that she returned, with her face crimson from anger,  to "Get away from my desk!" when all I did was ASK HER FOR MORE WORK.  When an employee that sits by you walks up to you, on their own, after witnessing the way that this person has treated you, in front of other employees, and says, "It's not you, it's HER, she treats us all like this, you'll get used it, like we all have, it's NOT you!", you realize IMMEDIATELY what a HUGE mistake that you have made in taking this job.  Please save yourself the stress of looking for another job.  This place was like working in hell every day.

review_title: Poor management, false promises, do not care about emploees

job_title: CMT in Jefferson City, MO
pros: To work in a place where you can enjoy coming to work! The residents are awesome to work with. They will be missed. It have all the essentials to up hold all duties and task needing performed. Can be a stressfree enviorment to work with improvment. Can be the best place to work.
cons: Working at this community was a great experience. I was a loyal employee. I worked hard to delivary the delicate compassation care I did. You not allow to say a word at this commutity. The people who run this community use their power to make you feel less then them. They are very unorganized. They never have enough staff to work.  Because they run all employees away with their unprofessional personaities. They have a program in place call culture change. Which is a big joke. It supposed to be a patient center care program that provide care around the patient needs. Really it is not. At this community it will never be a success. State mandatory issues is not handle in a manner that employees can not execise the company policy for reporting. This is the worst place I ever work. So much under the table business. And all the other reviews is true. I experience all the good and bad. Hope the next new employee have a better chance for advancement. Cause I never had a chance walking though the door. Sad how they treat loyal commited employees.
